hints.content:
The area is the number of unit squares it takes to cover the rectangle.

![Same rectangle with width labeled 10 and height labeled 2.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/162f480ee40a3aa0050338c1c12b3405af5d11a2)

The rectangle has $\tealE{2}$ rows with $\goldE{10}$ unit squares per row.

###Repeated addition

We can find the area by adding the unit squares from each row:

$\underbrace{\goldE{10}+\goldE{10}}_{\tealE{2}\text{ rows}}$

###Multiplication

We can also write repeated addition as multiplication:

$\goldE{10}+\goldE{10}=\goldE{10} \times \tealE{2}$

We multiply $\goldE{\text{width}} \times \tealE{\text{height}}$.

We can use these expressions to find the area of the rectangle:

- $10+10$
- $10 \times 2$

question.content:
![a square.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/cf1bd91baa66c66cb18a1aa62c8fc168e2b37f7d) is $1$ unit square.

![a rectangle 10 squares wide and 2 squares high.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/80744f104cf8191a40b10c4fb7fd62a47e29faa4)

**Which expressions can we use to find the area of the rectangle?**
